fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
* When a page is copied, the attachments are copied along, but the page itself will be referencing the images from the original page.
* If the original page is purged, or if there's any permission/restriction tied to it, the attachments won't load on the copied page.
* If the copied page is moved to another space, some users cannot view the attachments due to the lack of browsing permission on the original space.
** This issue also reproducible when the page is moved.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a page with attachments in it.
# Copy the page.
** Notice that the copied page will have it's own copy of the same attachment in (*...* > *Attachments*)
# The page itself will still be pulling/displaying the attachment from the original page via *ri:content-title*.
# Restrict the original page.
** Any user not allowed to view the original page cannot view the attachments on the copied page even if there's no restriction there, and they'll get a *Failed to load* error message.
# Remove the restriction and delete the original page.
** All users will see an *Unknown Attachment* error message.

h3. Expected Results
* The copied page should reference the attachment on it's own page.

h3. Actual Results
* The copied page references the attachment from the original page.

h3. Workaround
* The attachment needs to be uploaded again on the copied page.
** Note: As we cannot select the attachment already on the page from the *Files & Images* tab, the attachment needs to be uploaded anew, and another copy of the same attachment is created on the copied page.
fields.summary: Copied page references attachments from original page

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When you have thousands of site spaces, you may have problems when loading the space permissions page in the general settings of Confluence Cloud. This seems to manifest when you have more than four thousand site spaces, but that number can vary.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create 4 thousand spaces or more
 # Try to access the general settings -> Space permissions page

h3. Expected Results

The page loads fine.
h3. Actual Results

The page turns unresponsive, and fails to load, this problem seems to be intermittent there are times where the page loads after a while, wherein in other situations it doesn't load.

A 500 error is thrown in the browser console:

!Screen Shot 2020-11-26 at 19.43.45 (1).png|thumbnail!
h3. Workaround

Given the intermittent nature, one workaround is to try again.
h3. Solution

 The proposed solution is to add pagination to the space permissions page.
fields.summary: Space permissions page in the general settings page is not loading

h3. Issue Summary
When creating a page using ADF Confluence will throw a NullPointerException and return 500 if any {{content}} property is null. This should either return 400 (because the document doesn't match the schema) or (preferably) accept the null as an empty list.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Construct an ADF document where a paragraph node has: {{"content": null}}
# POST to create a new page using ADF as the content format.
# Check response.

h3. Expected Results
Ideally a 200 OK with the null content treated as an empty list.

h3. Actual Results
Get a 500 with message indicating a NullPointerException.

h3. Workaround
Always specify a list/array even if empty.
fields.summary: Creating a page with ADF returns 500 if content is null

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
The examples given for creating or updating an attachment on a page do not actually specify the content of the attachment. They shows how to PUT with headers but with no file given, so there's no actual file content uploaded by the PUT.

It's not obvious whether you can use {{PUT /content/(pid)/child/attachment}} or have to use {{PUT /content/(pid)/child/attachment/(aid)/data}} to update the attached file.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Go to REST API docs to see [how to add attachment|https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/confluence/rest/api-group-content---attachments/#api-api-content-id-child-attachment-put].
 # Look at examples.

h3. Expected Results
Examples should show how the file itself is specified in the POST/PUT request.

h3. Actual Results
Examples just show the headers, with no actual file specified in the request. They seem to be generic examples of make REST requests, rather than specific examples for this end-point.

Python example (note that URL is not valid either as it contains place-holder for page ID):
{code:python}
url = "https://your-domain.atlassian.net/wiki/rest/api/content/{id}/child/attachment"

headers = {
   "Accept": "application/json"
}

response = requests.request(
   "PUT",
   url,
   headers=headers
)
{code}

h3. Workaround
None.
fields.summary: REST API to create/update attachments has invalid examples

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

On Confluence Cloud, it is possible to search for the attachment title, in order to easily find it on the Instance. However, it would be very useful if Confluence displays on the search results the page title (with a link to it) as well. This would help to find pages based on their attachments, and also have a clearer understanding of which attachment was found.
h3. Proposed Solution

Along with the attachment tile, display the page title in which the file is attached. It would be also useful if the user could specify how many levels of pages in the hierarchy would be included on the search results, e.g:
 * Searching for *attachment X* and specifying three levels on the ancestors, would return:
 ** The attachment.
 ** The page in which the attachment was attached to (let's call it *Page 1*).
 ** Page 1's parent page (let's call it *Page 2*).
 ** Page 2's parent page (let's call it *Page 3*).
fields.summary: Include the page title when searching for attachments

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

The sprint field value is not reflected in the confluence page when using the jira issue macro if the "jira.issue.editable" property is set to false for the closed/done status in the corresponding Jira project's workflow.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 * In Jira:

 # Create a scrum project with some issues(stories, bugs, etc)
 # Start and complete a sprint with some issues in it.
 # Edit the project's workflow and set the *jira.issue.editable* property to *false* for the closed/done status.
 # Publish the draft workflow.

 * In Confluence:

 # Create a page and insert the Jira issue macro - Use a filter or JQL to display the issues that were in the sprint. Ensure that the sprint column is added to the table.

 * *Video demonstration*:
 [^Effect of Closed status's workflow property JIM.mov]

h3. Expected Results

On the confluence page, the Jira issue macro should reflect the Sprint value for the issue under the Sprint column.
h3. Actual Results

Observe that the sprint value does not get populated under the Sprint column. If you remove the jira.issue.editable in the Jira project's workflow(publish the draft workflow), refresh the issues in the Jira issue macro output, it will then reflect the value of the sprint in the sprint column.
h3. Workaround

Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: The sprint field value is not reflected in the confluence page when using the jira issue macro if the "jira.issue.editable" property is set to false for the closed status in the corresponding Jira project's workflow.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary This issue has been raised in response to https://community.developer.atlassian.com/t/edit-mode-loads-stale-macro-context-after-the-context-has-been-updated/43312. The following steps reproduce an issue which impacts Confluence user experience and prohibits implementing key functionality when developing macros. The bug produces old, stale macros which are momentarily rendered when they should not be. h3. Steps to Reproduce   # Create a basic connect app which includes the following Dynamic Content Macro. This test macro includes a parameter to more closely recreate what would happen with an actual production app macro (see macro definition below). # Use the banana.html (see below), which includes a crude but simple script to render based on the parameter data. # Insert the macro into a Confluence page, with some test text in the parameter input field. # Save the macro (let’s call this ‘macro state A’). # Observe the rendered content, which is based on the parameter value. # Publish the page. # Edit the page. # Edit the macro and change the parameter to a different text value. # Save the macro (let’s call this ‘macro state B’) and publish the page. # Edit the page and observe what is rendered. h4. Macro definition {code:java} { "key": "bananamacro", "name": { "value": "Banana" }, "url": "/macro/banana.html", "description": { "value": "Yellow banana" }, "outputType": "block", "bodyType": "none", "parameters": [ { "identifier": "param1", "name": { "value": "Test Parameter" }, "description": { "value": "A test parameter" }, "type": "string", "required": true } ] }{code} h4. banana.html {code:java} Banana

Loading...

{code} h3. Expected Results The macro is rendered with macro state B. h3. Actual Results The macro is rendered with ‘macro state A’ briefly, before being replace with ‘macro state B’ When the macro is rendered with ‘macro state A’, the entire macro code is run with the old, obsolete context. If we consider this behaviour occurring in a production application’s macro, then depending on what your macro does exactly, I believe this could result in anything from an annoying visual bug to potentially a legitimate security concern. The entire macro code is run when this ‘phantom macro’ is rendered, using the old context, meaning erroneous side effects (sentry calls, analytic collections, Confluence AP Events) are produced. Since AP Events are produced, this severely impacts the usefulness of that feature - it’s difficult or impossible to code around this as your code does not expect these events. h3. Workaround None
fields.summary: Edit mode leads to the rendering of stale macro data

fields.description:
It would be awesome if we could put todo items anywhere as inline items instead of them needing to be top-level block content in a given text container.

One example of this would be allowing a todo item to be created under a nested bullet item in a list.

*Steps to reproduce:*
 # Create a list (click bulleted list item in Confluence's editor)
 # Type text in the first bullet
 # Hit `Enter` to create a second list item
 # Hit `Tab` to nest the second list item under the first
 # Click the new todo item button in the editor menu

*Current behavior:*
A todo item is placed _after_ the list entirely, outside of the bulleted items.

*Desired behavior:*
A todo item is placed within the nested bullet item, as an inline element comprised of a checkbox, text and optional mentions.
fields.summary: Allow todo items inside bulleted lists & other nesting structures

fields.description:
Many JavaScript APIs support promises. For example, the context API supports the provision of a callback or using promises. However, AP.confluence operations only support callback.

 
{code:java}
AP.context.getContext(console.log); // OK
AP.context.getContext().then(context => {console.log(JSON.stringify(context, null, 2))}); // OK

AP.confluence.getContentProperty('editor', console.log); // OK
AP.confluence.getContentProperty('editor').then(contentProperty => console.log(JSON.stringify(contentProperty, null, 2))); // NOT SUPPORTED
{code}
Providing support for promises will improve the clarity of code and provide support for error handling.
fields.summary: Enhance AP.confluence operations to support promises

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
It is possible to create a page using [Atlassian Document Format|https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/jira/platform/apis/document/structure/] (ADF) but the [Confluence Cloud REST API|https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/confluence/rest/intro/] documentation doesn't mention "editor" as a content type, nor "atlas_doc_format" as a representation. In fact it doesn't seem to define the formats or representations at all, other than by giving a few examples, so is not complete enough for users to work out how to use the API.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Consult the [Create content|https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/confluence/rest/api-group-content/#api-api-content-post] section in the API docs to find out how to create a page.
 # Scroll to the *Body Parameters* subsection to find out what to put in the payload.

h3. Expected Results
The {{body}} parameter should specify a structure with available formats and representations. It should allow creation of content using any supported format, including ADF.

h3. Actual Results
The {{body}} parameter is described only in vague terms:
{quote}
The body of the new content. Does not apply to attachments. Only one body format should be specified as the property for this object, e.g. storage.

Note, editor2 format is used by Atlassian only. anonymous_export_view is the same as 'export_view' format but only content viewable by an anonymous user is included.
{quote}
It talks about a "body format" without explaining what that means. The example POST given next shows that {{body}} actually has a structure and requires a format with a value and a representation, but is not actually a valid payload (should only have one format), and the full set of available formats and representations is not defined.

h3. Workaround
There is a [question in Community|https://community.developer.atlassian.com/t/can-i-create-content-in-confluence-cloud-using-atlassian-document-format-adf-rather-than-storage-format/30720] that includes part of the answer, for ADF at least.
fields.summary: REST API does not specify formats or representations for body content

[https://community.developer.atlassian.com/t/root-page-of-copied-page-tree-not-displaying-in-left-nav-sidebar-after-using-pagehierarchy-api/43005]

 # 
 ## View a page

 ## On a debug point in
{code:java}
[redacted] {code}

h3. Issue Summary

If there is some custom content that has been recently created via a third-party app (tested with Gliffy diagram) and then app is uninstalled, then recent updates API (*{color:#505f79}{{wiki/rest/dashboardmacros/1.0/updates.json}}{color}*) may return an error. Presumably it happens because it can't read some info from the app descriptor.

As of June 2020 this API is called from Confluence home page recent updates feed, which causes it to display an error.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Install "Gliffy Diagrams for Confluence" app: [https://marketplace.atlassian.com/apps/254/gliffy-diagrams-for-confluence]
 # Create a new page and a Gliffy Diagram from Insert menu.
 # Publish the diagram and the page.
 # Go to Confluence Home page and check the recent updates feed on the right: both page with attachments created by Gliffy and a Gliffy diagram itself should appear in the list (see attached recent_updates_feed_good.png).
 # Uninstall "Gliffy Diagrams for Confluence" app from Settings (gear icon near the avatar) -> Manage Apps menu.
 # Go back to Confluence Home page.

h3. Expected Results

Recent updates feed should still display results in some way.

Recent Updates API should gracefully handle such situations because it seems to be a common case. UX input is required. We can either exclude troubling results from the list or, if it just a matter of displaying a proper icon, display some default icon instead.
h3. Actual Results

Recent updates feed now displays an error and no results (see attached recent_updates_feed_error.png).

Calling the API that is called by a feed (wiki/rest/dashboardmacros/1.0/updates.json?maxResults=40&tab=all&showProfilePic=true&labels=&spaces=&users=&types=&category=&spaceKey=) returns an error:
{noformat}
{"message": "Expected an enabled ContentTypeModuleDescriptor for key ac:com.gliffy.integration.confluence:gliffy-diagram, found none","status-code": 500,"stack-trace": ""}
{noformat}
h3. Workaround

Install the Gliffy app back or delete diagrams from Confluence pages.
fields.summary: Recent Updates API returns an error if there are contents of unknown type

fields.description:
*Summary*
Jira issue macro should have an option to render the data in the absolute format in Confluence.

At present, the current behaviour/expected behaviour is if the Jira issue is updated <= 7 days ago. On Confluence it will show relative date format.
{panel}
Jira behaviour at the same time:
- When the date of the action is <= 7 days ago, you'll be able to switch between relative and absolute formats by clicking on the timestamp.
- When the date of the action is > 7 days ago, it will always show the timestamp in absolute format, as per our design guidelines.

FR - [Enabling Absolute Date/Time for JIRA issue view|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-41506]  Status : *Won't Fix*
{panel}

Clicking on the relative time stamp on Jira does change it to absolute value but it on Confluence it renders the relative value only.

Hence users who are exporting reports from confluence especially from Jira issue macro are seeing relative dates like below screenshot. 

*Suggestion*
Enable an option to see the same absolute date format on Confluence upon using Jira issue macro. Or
Jira issue macro should have an option to render the data in the absolute format in Confluence.

Workaround (/)
At this point, users can use a custom field date or date/time picker to pull the report with absolute value.
fields.summary: Jira issue macro should have an option to render the date in the absolute format in Confluence.

h3. Issue Summary

However, upon creating new pages with the fabric editor, as we don't have the option heading column (Legacy editor), it is only possible to display the information from the table vertically.

This cause confusion for users, as our documentation is specifying that it should work, but we don't have this option available.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a page with a properties macro report
 # Create another page with a properties macro
 # On the properties macro, insert a table and fill the columns to display
 # Save
 # Publish the page

h3. Expected Results

The results will show up on the page properties report as expected.
h3. Actual Results

As the table on fabric don't have the heading column option for tables, it is not possible to make the table display the content for the page properties macro horizontally, only vertically.
h3. Workaround
If you have a page created with the legacy editor, but wants to display the information on the fabric editor (new editor), you can copy the existing legacy page, edit it and then convert it to the fabric editor.
This will show up the content for the page properties macro to show up horizontally.

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Customer migrates large confluence server instances to cloud. Currently for confluence there is a 200MB uncompressed XML limit per https://support.atlassian.com/confluence-cloud/docs/migrate-a-confluence-cloud-site-to-an-existing-cloud-site/. For larger customers even if they break down the backup into space exports. Their space exports can exceed that size pretty easily.

h3. Suggested Solution
Provide a method for larger customers to migrate large XML imports into Cloud.

h3. Workaround
- Reduce space size by curating and archiving older data into backups to meet compliance needs.
Break down larger spaces into smaller spaces that meet the ~200MB size limit for imports.

- The current solution for migration is to use CCMA plugin.
https://marketplace.atlassian.com/apps/1219672/confluence-cloud-migration-assistant?hosting=server&tab=overview
fields.summary: Increase size limit for imports for bigger customers migrating from server to cloud.

**  !Upload2.PNG|thumbnail!

# But if we check on the *Attachments* page, in another tab, the attachments have already been uploaded, and can even be downloaded.
**  !Upload3.PNG|thumbnail!

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create an Excel file with around 4-5Mb worth of data.

# You will hit into the *Failed to Load* error.
# Publish the page and check the attachments to confirm that the attachment has already been uploaded.
# Edit the page again, and click on the *Files and Images* option, and the attachment will still appear to be uploading.
# Leave the page for some time (~10 minutes), and the attachment will appear fine on the page.


h3. Expected Results
* Attachment uploads and preview fine as soon as it's uploaded.

h3. Actual Results
* Attachment appears to have not been uploaded when it has already been uploaded.

h3. (!) Note
# I was unable to replicate the issue while on Atlassian network. 
# Issue only occurs when using personal network.
# Connection was good on both network, and as the file was already uploaded, this should not be an issue.


h3. Workaround
Currently there is no known workaround for this behaviour. A workaround will be added here when available

As an app developer, I need to understand if the Confluence storage format is guaranteed to be safe from XSS attacks. This information is missing in the documentation. Also see https://community.developer.atlassian.com/t/macros-and-rich-text-and-xss/43043.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Visit the reference documentation describing Confluence storage format (https://confluence.atlassian.com/doc/confluence-storage-format-790796544.html) and where it is exposed such as static content macros (https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/confluence/modules/static-content-macro/).

h3. Expected Results

At step 1, the documentation indicates whether Confluence storage format is vulnerable to XSS attacks.
h3. Actual Results

At step 1, the documentation does not indicate whether Confluence storage format is vulnerable to XSS attacks.
h3. Workaround

Program defensively by assuming the XML may be vulnerable to XSS attacks.
fields.summary: Confluence storage format reference documentation does not indicate if the XML is subject to XSS attacks
Misleading information and Typo in "Configure the indexing language"

fields.description:
Currently, our users can get via REST API the body content from a page only in the *XHTML-based* format.

It would be really helpful to automation/integration if users also have the option to get content in *plaintext* format.
fields.summary: Ability to get via REST API the body content in plaintext

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Users report Jira fields with checkbox type can't be displayed correctly in *Jira Issue Macro Table.*  This happened intermittently.  

reported fields including: _+flagged+_, +_Change Related (custom field)_+
h3. Steps to Reproduce

Unable to reproduce the issue on Atlassian test instances, but able to observe this behavior on several customer's instance.
h3. Expected Results

This kind of Jira field should be displayed correctly in Jira Macro Table. 
h3. Actual Results

Blank column in Jira Macro Table. 
h3. Workaround

no workaround so far.
fields.summary: Jira Macro Table can't display checkbox field data

fields.description:
h3. Summary

While editing a Confluence page, sometimes we need to indent our text for a bit, hitting the *TAB* keyboard key a few times, until letting the text the way we want. Though, it seems that this doesn't work for some features, like the bullet/numbered lists:

!image-2020-11-16-09-42-54-934.png|width=752,height=455!
h3. Suggestion
 * Add the possibility to be able to indent lists on Confluence, as well as it is possible for text.
fields.summary: Ability to indent lists with the TAB key

fields.description:
This is a feature that I've seen 5+ year old discussions about. When using the Spaces List macro and choosing scope of spaces to be category, the result is a list where the user than has a drop-down choice box to select a category to display. In many cases this is not what you would actually want.

I would like a version of this macro that allows me to define the category inside the macro creation, so that the result is a list of spaces in a set category.

E.g.

On a page I can have this macro list all spaces in the _team-projects_ category, another instance might list all spaces in the _Employee-manuals_ category, etc.
fields.summary: List Spaces with macro specified category

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Currently, when we are reading a page in Confluence Cloud, we can use the up/down arrow keyboard keys to navigate the page, without the need to use the mouse scroller wheel or dragging and dropping the browser's scrollbar. 
Though, for people that prefer to use the keys to navigate, this experience is not the best one, since the page scrolls too slow.

h3.Suggestion
* Improve the page navigation with the arrow keys, making it faster - or at least let it something that the user can customize directly on his/her user profile on Confluence.
fields.summary: Enhance page navigation with up/down arrow keys

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
The in-editor search is a great feature that came in the new editor to make our life easier, as we can find and replace text easily. 
Though, it seems that is not respecting some basic functionalities.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a page with some random [lorem ipsum|https://www.lipsum.com/] text;
# After that, enter in the editing mode of this page and call the search using *CTRL + F* / *Command + F*;
# Type "_Donec_";
# Select all the searched text and hit the backspace keyboard key/try to overwrite the text.

h3. Expected Results
The text gets deleted/overwritten. 

h3. Actual Results
Nothing happens.

h3. Workaround
After deleting the searched text three times selecting it all, then it will behave as expected. If you close the search box it gets reset and you need to repeat this procedure again.
fields.summary: Cannot delete/overwrite text from the search box within the editor after selecting all

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

The x-axis isn’t showing the data vertically correctly on Chart macro.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a new page on Confluence.
 # Insert the Chart macro.
 # Use the following example:
 ** Create the *table* inside the macro:
{quote}
|Date|Count|
|01/10/2020|1|
|02/10/2020|2|
|03/10/2020|3|
|04/10/2020|5|
|05/10/2020|8|
|06/10/2020|13|
|07/10/2020|21|
|08/10/2020|34|
|09/10/2020|55|
|10/10/2020|89|
{quote}
 ** Use the *Chart* parameters:
{quote}
|Type|timeSeries|
|Display Orientation|vertical|
|Width|500|
|Display Chart Data|after|
|Horizontal-axis Label|Label|
|Horizontal-axis Label|Grafico2|
|Show Legend?|Check|
|Time Series?|Check|
|Forgive|Check|
|Domain Axis Tick Unit|1|
|Date Tick Mark Position|middle|
{quote}

h3. Expected Results
 * The x-axis shows the data vertically *without scrambling* them.
|!Chart+example.png|thumbnail!|

h3. Actual Results
 * The x-axis shows the data horizontally *scrambling* all of them.
|!Screen Shot 2020-11-13 at 13.11.52.png|thumbnail!|

h3. Workaround
 * Increase the *Width* Chart macro parameter, so the data will be visible but will keep horizontally.
|!Screen Shot 2020-11-13 at 13.14.23.png|thumbnail!|
fields.summary: The x-axis isn’t showing the data vertically on Chart macro

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
For some attachments, thumbnails are not loading

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Edit a page and attach some files (can be images or other files)
# Publish the page
# Reload it

h3. Expected Results
Thumbnails should load

h3. Actual Results
Some thumbnails keep trying to load forever
 !image-2020-11-12-19-04-52-714.png|thumbnail! 

* No errors shown on the browser's console or network requests.
* It doesn't seem to affect all files on a page, some of them load as expected after scrolling down the page.

h3. Workaround
Access the file through *•••* -> *Attachments*
fields.summary: Thumbnails for certain attachments are not loading on pages

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
It is possible to subscribe pages, blog posts and spaces to slack channels, as we have the slack integration with Confluence.
However, while the Chat Notifications have permissions on the space, instance and connected to a workspace already, the Channel dropdown menu to choose a channel in slack is greyed out, hence the confirm button as well.

In order to make it work, it is necessary to add a new workspace and allow Confluence Cloud to access Slack workspace again.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Make sure to have the instance connected to Slack
 # Create a page or blog post
 # Click on Slack Notifications
 # You'll see a workspace already, but not able to choose a channel

h3. Expected Results
If the workspace is already connected to the instance, you should be able to choose the channel.

h3. Actual Results
The channel dropdown list is greyed.

h3. Workaround
 # Click on the  *workspace* dropdown > *+ add new workspace* 
#  Click on Connect workspace button
# Allow "Confluence Cloud is requesting permission to access the Slack workspace"
# After that, you should be able to choose a channel from your slack to subscribe the blog post or page.
# You can also do it from within slack, by typing the command /confluence connect <URL link here>
fields.summary: Subscribing a blog/page or space to a slack channel not working properly.

fields.description:
Currently, our users can reorder their pages alphabetically in *A-Z ascending* order only on the sidebar.

It would be really helpful if users have the ability to reorder pages by the *creation date* of the child page descending.
fields.summary: Reorder pages by creation date on the sidebar

fields.description:
Confluence currently does not publish rate limits despite the API returning rate limit responses at times. The current [rate limiting guidance|https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/confluence/rate-limiting/] explains that rate limits are not published because rate limiting is implemented by concurrency and resource limits. However, there are use cases, such as migrations, where apps need to know the rate of API calls that can be safely made before rate limiting may be applied.

Note: There is an equivalent request for Jira: https://ecosystem.atlassian.net/browse/ACJIRA-2255
fields.summary: As an app developer, I need to know the rate limits that my app is subject to

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Find and replace breaks if the search term is in a table
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # create a page
 # add content with a target string e.g. "Long Term Support"
 # put one of these strings in a header column of a table
 # click on the magnifying glass to find and replace
 # search for "Long Term Suport"
 # cycle through each hit

h3. Expected Results

each hit is cycled through and the user can go back and forth at will
h3. Actual Results

The find and replace bar converts to a different toolbar and drops the search (see attached screen cap)
h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Editor - find and replace breaks if search term is in a table

fields.description:
When creating a new page in Confluence, the template panel shows Atlassian default templates at the top. Users who have their own templates and do not use Atlassian templates have to scroll down past them to find their custom templates. These can be manually disabled, but the user must repeat the process of manually disabling default templates each time Atlassian rolls out new ones.

Creating an option to disable Atlassian templates by default would resolve this issue.
fields.summary: Create option for admins to disable default Atlassian page templates for all users

fields.description: The ability to disable email notifications for a single page and perhaps its child pages would be a great feature for pages that contain sensitive information as distributing sensitive information via email is not desirable.
fields.summary: Ability to disable email notifications for a single page

fields.description:
h3. Summary
With the [new page creation experience|https://community.atlassian.com/t5/Confluence-articles/A-new-create-flow-and-templates-experience-is-coming-to/ba-p/1302116], where we are now selecting the template we wish for our new page after entering in the editor, it brought a different and interesting way to work on Confluence. 
By default, every time we hit the *Creat* button, the template sidebar is shown at the right, providing us with the list of available templates for that space.

h3. Suggestion
* For some users, the template sidebar popping up every time a new page is being created is a bit inconvenient, so it would be great if we could have an option to make this sidebar optional to pop-up right after entering in the editor for a new page - if the user wants a different template, then he-she can click over an option in the editor to show the sidebar;
* This could be set at the user profile, like the default page width works today.
fields.summary: Ability to make the new template sidebar hidden by default

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Unable to remove the *default* space name from the task report macro, and due to that task report macro shows task from other pages as well, so we can not show tasks from a specific page(current page)
 !image-2020-11-11-20-29-41-904.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Step 1 Create a page 2 page and and insert few tasks
 # Step 2 create another page insert task report macro,  select current page in task report macro.
 !image-2020-11-11-20-33-36-797.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Expected Results
We should be able to remove default space from the *Space(s) and page(s)* 
 !image-2020-11-11-20-33-41-010.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Actual Results
If we remove default space(current space) name from *Space(s) and page(s)* and save the macro and edit gain it again shows the default space in *Space(s) and page(s)* field.

And it shows all the tasks from the whole space or from the original page if we create a copy from the original page.
 !image-2020-11-11-20-38-05-042.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Currently, when we share a page from Confluence with someone else, the email notification provides a message saying X user shared a page with you, and you have a button to jump into the page in Confluence.

h3. Suggestion
It would be nice to have an option to show all the page's content in the email notification, and then a link to view the page in Confluence in case the user would like to do that.
fields.summary: Ability to show all the page's content in the email notification when a page is shared

fields.description:
Currently, when checking the restrictions for a page via REST API, the inherited permissions are not listed.

If the page has no restrictions other than the inherited ones, no restrictions are returned.
fields.summary: Ability to list inherited page restrictions via REST API

fields.description:
Suggestion
 *Improve the messaging for the restricted page.* This is really useful where multiple spaces are enabled with Anonymous access. So when users access these pages without logging and navigate to another space (which is not enabled with Anonymous access), they are under impression that they do not have access to pages but actually since they are not logged in they see this error message.

So, it will be good to improve the page/space restriction message where it prompts to login to the account.
 !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail!

Suggestion
 *Improve the messaging for the restricted page for licensed users.*
fields.summary: Improve the messaging for restricted page/space for licensed user

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When searching for a user using CQL via AP.request, no results are returned for apps that declare their `auth` type as `none`.
h3. Steps to Reproduce

Script A:
{code:java}
AP.request({
  contentType: 'application/json',
  type: 'GET',
  url: '/rest/api/search/user?cql=user.fullname~a',
  success: function(response) {
    console.log(JSON.parse(response))
  }
})
{code}
 # Install Connect app A which declares jwt auth (and has a back end) and which contributes an app iframe.

 # Install Connect app B which declared none auth (only has a front end) and which contributes an app iframe. e.g. [https://dugaldmorrow.github.io/content-property-browser/confluence-connect-descriptor.json]

 # Visit a page where Connect app A’s iframe is visible.

 # In the browser dev tools, run script A in the context of Connect app A’s iframe and record the results.

 # Visit a page where Connect app B’s iframe is visible.

 # In the browser dev tools, run script A in the context of Connect app B’s iframe and record the results.

h3. Expected Results

At both steps 4 and 6, script A returns the the details of all users matching the query cql=user.fullname~a which includes the Confluence Analytics app since this is a system app installed in all tenants.
h3. Actual Results

At step 6, no results are returned.
h3. Workaround

None
fields.summary: non-JWT Atlassian Connect apps user search always returns 0 results

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When editing a page, sometimes the editor will load older contents from the draft, only loading the current draft after some seconds.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a page and publish it
# Edit the page, perform some changes but don't publish it, close the editor instead
# Edit the page again and publish it this time
# Edit the page a last time

h3. Expected Results
It should load the current draft

h3. Actual Results
It loads contents from an old draft
 [^old_draft (2).mp4] 
This problem intensifies for certain pages, taking around 10 seconds to load the current draft.

h3. Workaround
 Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Editor loads old contents first

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

The problem happens for old pages (fabric though) that have Jira macros, the macro won't list the issues throwing "JIRA project doesn't exist or you don't have permission to view it." for any users even with access to the project/ issues.

It seems like Jira Macro can't recognize Jira Search URL 
h3. Steps to Reproduce

it's only happening for existing macros created a few months ago using the Jira URL instead of a JQL.
h3. Expected Results

Table should be displayed correctly.
h3. Actual Results

Table can't be shown correctly

h3. Workaround
Edit the Jira macro and publish it again.
fields.summary: Jira Macro can't display correct results if created by Jira search's URL
